content: //www ravelry com/designers/mary-anne-mace 2 beads approximately 245 size 6 seed beads 270 for larger working from the charts size the shawl has two garter edge stitches plus one stitch which is increased into which are not included in the recommended needle size charts 4 mm us6 circular needle 100 cm 40 inches or longer work the edges as follows on all rs odd numbered row 75 mm crochet hook for beading k2 k1 yo k1 into one stitch then work as per chart to the last 3 sts k1 yo k1 into one stitch k2 gauge work the edges as follows on all ws row k2 yo to create 20 sts / 30 row per 10 cm 4 inches with 4mm us6 a stitch then purl to the last 2 sts yo k2 the yo created needles over stocking stitch on ws row is the stitch that is used to make two extra stitches on rs row pattern notes and techniques each rs row starts at the right edge of the chart work to this shawl begins with a stretchy garter tab throughout the outlined repeat section work the repeat section as the shawl 2 sts are increased at each edge on rs row 4 in many times as instructed then continue on and work the total one stitch is increased at each edge on ws row 2 in stitches to the left of the repeat section total therefore every second row 6 extra stitches are made through side increases knit the edge stitches loosely throughout the charts consecutive knit stitch counts are given for your convenience these numbers represent the lifted increase extra increases are included throughout the number of consecutive knit stitches from one object in the stocking stitch section of the shawl to aid its crescent chart to any other object such as a stitch symbol or bold shape the right lifted increase is worked on the stitch pattern repeat line immediately below the next stitch on the left needle lift the right leg of that stitch onto the left needle and knit it ws row are not charted see chart directions below for how to work ws row right and left twists rt and lt are mock cables they also look like decreases performed on two stitches and results key in two stitches once executed they look very much like a k on rs right and left leaning decrease k2tog and ssk there are a oyo number of way of executing right and left twists but i urge k2tog you to perform them in the way described here so they \ssk slip st p-wise look like an extension of the right and left leaning decreases tsk2p moving across the surface of the fabric z nupp right twist k2tog leave stitches on left needle k into first place bead st again and slide both sts off needle lt left twist rt right twist left twist slip 2 stitches individually knitwise put back on 2/1 rc left needle
